1604952415_1AkCd6161a4erMEbe4998aX7Hnpd2.body: I think you mean a program that makes malware undetectable by an antivirus. You're going to be disappointed: there are no crypters, at least none that work in the long term. You make your own when you need one. If you want to make malware undetectable, you need to make it yourself. Probably in assembly, as C adds some code overhead that sometimes will make easier for the AV companies to find a pattern and detect your binary as what it is. You should also consider making it polymorphic so that it mutates itself, which adds yet another layer of complexity. Stop whatever you are trying to do, and go learn C and assembly. It will be hard, but it's the only way. Maybe you get discouraged on the way and dedicate your time to doing good things. Good luck!

1604988183_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nw.body: If I assume you can't just upgrade, you probably won't be able to. Find another way: if you can install Docker, you're all set, use nofish/zeronet; otherwise, you'll probably want to try a chroot jail.
